body.p:
Frankfort, Ky. Dec 21" 1863
Gen, Boyle
Sir:

The money at Mt. Sterling is in the hands of Barnes, White & Co. an Exchange Bank in that place. Capt. Williams left it there. And you will please ^send^ Gov. Bramlette another order on the above named firm for the money.

I am respectfully
Your obt Servt
Wm Watkins

H182 (D K) 1863
Frankfort Ky --
Dec 21st 1863
Watkins. William --
Reports that the money at Mount Sterling is in hands of Barnes White and Co. requests that Gov Bramlette be be sent another order for the money

Head Qrs Dist of Ky and 1st Dist 23rd A. C.
Louisville, Ky Decr 24th 63
Respectfully referred to Gov. Thomas E. Bramlette enclosing orders on Barnes White and Co. Richmond Ky. for the money taken from Keller.

J. T. Boyle
Brig Genl Comdg.
